title: Provide a downloadable Android app experience (APK + install guidance) for EOATravelDeals

requirements.text: Add a clear in-app entry point that explains how to install EOATravelDeals on a phone as a downloadable app, offering both (1) PWA installation from Android Chrome and (2) a developer/testing option to install a sideloaded debug APK built from the existing Capacitor Android wrapper.

quotes: I don't want to app web page I want to downloadable app that you can download onto your phone and use

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated and authenticated users can find an in-app link or section labeled in clear English (e.g., “Install on Android”)
The in-app instructions include both paths: “Install as an app (recommended)” via PWA and “Downloadable APK (developer/testing)” via Capacitor build
The in-app instructions do not mention any non-Internet-Identity sign-in methods (no Google/Instagram/email auth references)
All user-facing text added/modified for this entry point is in English

requirements.text: Ensure the repository documentation remains accurate and complete for producing a downloadable Android APK from the existing Capacitor wrapper, including the required environment variable configuration and the exact APK output path.

quotes: I don't want to app web page I want to downloadable app that you can download onto your phone and use

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/docs/android.md` includes (and keeps) explicit steps to set `CAPACITOR_SERVER_URL` via a `.env.capacitor` file copied from `frontend/.env.capacitor.example`
The docs explicitly state that the Capacitor server URL must be HTTPS for Internet Identity to work
The docs explicitly state the debug APK output path: `android/app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk`
Documentation is clear English and consistent with the current app name “EOATravelDeals”

constraints: Do not add or rely on any authentication provider other than Internet Identity.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not introduce any external backend services or databases; keep the existing Internet Computer canister architecture unchanged.
nonGoals: Publishing to the Google Play Store (AAB signing, Play Console setup, store listing)
Adding push notifications or real-time socket features
